components/locale/Selector.Bottom Right: You can change the language at any time in the bottom right corner of the page. ↘️

components/modal/Error.Common Steps: Some common troubleshooting steps that might be helpful:
components/modal/Error.Connection Explanation: this site requires connection to the internet for most functionality.
components/modal/Error.Desktop: Visit this site on a desktop computer
components/modal/Error.Desktop Explanation: this site works best on desktop web browsers.
components/modal/Error.File a Bug: filing a bug in the PACTA repository
components/modal/Error.Heading: An error occurred
components/modal/Error.If Persists: If this issue persists, please report this issue by
components/modal/Error.Refresh Explanation: most of our pages save your progress as you go, so it's almost always fine to reload the page.
components/modal/Error.Subheading: Sorry about that, our team take bug reports seriously, and will try to make it right!

components/modal/FakeUsers.Description: Microsoft Active Directory doesn't allow us to programatically log in as other users, so you will need to manually log in as one of the users below. These are only in the Local environment (for now).
components/modal/FakeUsers.Heading: Fake Users
components/modal/FakeUsers.Subheading: Quickly switch between profiles for testing.

lib/editor/initiative.AffiliationHelpText: An optional description of the organization or entity that is hosting this initiative.
lib/editor/initiative.IDHelpText: This is the immutable unique identifier for the initiative. It can only contain alphanumeric characters, underscores, and dashes. This value will be shown in URLs, but will typically not be user visible.
lib/editor/initiative.Name: Name
lib/editor/initiative.InternalDescriptionHelpText: The description of the initiative that will be shown to members of the inititiative. Newlines will be respected.
lib/editor/initiative.PublicDescriptionHelpText: The description of the initiative that will be shown to the public. Newlines will be respected.
lib/editor/initiative.NameHelpText: The name of the PACTA initiative.
lib/editor/initiative.LanguageHelpText: What language should reports have when they are generated for this initiative?
lib/editor/initiative.PactaVersionHelpText: What version of the PACTA algorithm should this initiative use to generate reports?
lib/editor/initiative.RequiresInvitationToJoin: When disabled, anyone can join this initiative. When enabled, initiative administrators can mint invitation codes that they can share with folks to allow them to join the project.
lib/editor/initiative.AcceptingNewPortfoliosHelpText: When enabled, initiative members can add new portfolios to the initiative.
lib/editor/initiative.AcceptingNewMembersHelpText: When enabled, new members can join the project through the joining mechanism selected above.

components/modal/PermissionDenied.Email Us: If you think this is a bug (something that you should have access to), or if you want to let us know how you got here, please email us at
components/modal/PermissionDenied.Heading: Permission Denied
components/modal/PermissionDenied.How You Got Here: It is likely that you have gotten here either by entering in an invalid URL, or by clicking on a link or button that is not set up correctly.
components/modal/PermissionDenied.Subheading: You aren't authorized to view this page

components/AdminDebugEnabledToggleButton.ModalSubheading: Exercise caution - this changes who can see the data that you upload

components/portfolio/group/NewModal.You can do things here like create a por: Portfolio groups are a way to organize your portfolios for analysis or recordkeeping. You can create a portfolio group by clicking the button below.

components/portfolio/group/membership/Me.Add unselected portfolios to group: Add selected portfolios to this group
components/portfolio/group/membership/Me.Remove all portfolios from group: Remove selected portfolios from this group

components/portfolio/initiative/membersh.Add unselected portfolios to initiative: Add selected portfolios to this initiative
components/portfolio/initiative/membersh.Initiative is closed to new portfolios: Initiative is closed to new portfolios
components/portfolio/initiative/membersh.Remove all portfolios from initiative: Remove selected portfolios from this initiative

components/user/Editor.The name that will be associated with: The name that will be associated with
components/user/Editor.admin help text: If enabled, this user will have administrator priveledges.
components/user/Editor.language help text: What language should platform freatures that support internationalization default to for this user?
components/user/Editor.may be public: Note that this name may be accessible to a public audience.
components/user/Editor.super admin help text: If enabled, this user will have super-administrator priveledges.
components/user/Editor.this user: this user's public activities on the platform
components/user/Editor.you: your public activities on the platform

initiative/invitations.Heading: Initaitive Invitations
initiative/invitations.New Invitations Help: Create new invitations by clicking the button below. You can create as many invitations as you want, but each invitation can only be used once. Invitation codes must only contain alphanumeric characters (a-z, A-Z, 0-9), underscores and dashes. You can create multiple invitations at once by separating them with tabs, commas, newlines, or spaces.
initiative/invitations.No Invitations: This initiative does not require an invitation to join - anyone who finds this initiative can join it.
initiative/invitations.Yes Invitations: This initiative requires an invitation (a unique, one-time code) to join. You can create these invitations below.
initiative/invitations.You can change: You can change this behavior on the

lib/editor/portfolio.Name: Name
lib/editor/portfolio.NameHelpText: A name for the portfolio - this is only for organization and reference - it doesn't impact analysis.
lib/editor/portfolio.DescriptionHelpText: The description is optional, but can be used to provide additional context for the portfolio.
lib/editor/portfolio.AdminDebuggingEnabledHelpText: If enabled, this content of this portfolio will be accessible to administrators. When disabled, only you, the owner of this content, can access it.

This invitation has already been used.
pages/join.You can learn more about the initiative: You can learn more about the initiative here.
pages/join.You've been invited to join an initiativ: You've been invited to join an initiative
pages/join.do-accept: Do you want to accept this invitation?
pages/join.if-accept: If you accept this invitation, you'll be able to add your portfolios to the project, where they will be included in aggregated analysis. You aren't required to accept this invitation if you just want to run the analysis on your own, but joining the initiative may enable you to access internal benefits, like the ability to see the analysis results from the aggregated portfolios.
pages/join.what-shared: If you accept X, Y, Z will be whared with the initiative administrators, but A, B, C will not be.

pages/initiative/invitations.Yes Invitations: This initiative requires an invitation (a unique, one-time code) to join. You can create and manage these invitations below.
pages/initiative/invitations.You Can Change: You can change this behavior on the edit page by changing the requirement for an invitation to join the initiative.
pages/initiative/invitations.Create Subheader: Invitiations are one-time-codes that enable the user to join the initiative.
pages/initiative/invitations.New Invitations Help: Create new invitations by entering new values in the box below. If you don't care what the invitation codes look like you can press the randomize button to generate random ones. You can create as many invitations as you want, but each invitation can only be used once. Invitation codes must only contain alphanumeric characters (a-z, A-Z, 0-9), underscores and dashes. You can create multiple invitations at once by separating them with tabs, commas, newlines, or spaces.
